void create_web_server ( char *  port,
int  connections,
pthread_t *  t_web_server,
WEB_SERVER_PARAMS_T *  web_server_params 
)

Create a web server to listen on the specified port with maximum simultaneous connections.

Parameters:
portstring with the port number
connectionsinteger with the maximum number of simultaneous connections to server
t_web_serverwith the web server thread to use
web_server_paramsstructure to store the thread params
Author:
Brian "Beej Jorgensen" Hall <beej@beej.us>, Cláudio Esperança <cesperanc@gmail.com>, Diogo Serra <2081008@student.estg.ipleiria.pt>

char* update_content ( WEB_SERVER_PARAMS_T *  web_server_params,
char *  content,
char *  begin,
char *  middle,
char *  end 
)

Build a string with a beginning, a middle and an end.

Parameters:
web_server_paramsstructure to use on the thread lock
contentwith the reference to be free'd and appointed to the new string reference
beginstring with the first part of the string
middlestring to put in the middle
endstring to add at the end of the generated string
Returns:
a memory reference for the new string

Cláudio Esperança <cesperanc@gmail.com>, Diogo Serra <2081008@student.estg.ipleiria.pt>
